articles.headline: Broadcast of Golden Globes Is in Doubt
articles.snippet: Hollywood’s glamour machine is stuck between a promise that the stars will still show up at next month’s Golden Globes and a threat that 3,000 picketing writers will chase them away.
articles.abstract: Hollywood’s glamour machine is stuck between a promise that the stars will still show up at next month’s Golden Globes and a threat that 3,000 picketing writers will chase them away.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  Hollywood’s glamour machine is stuck between a promise that the stars will still show up at next month’s Golden Globes and a threat that 3,000 picketing writers will chase them away.

articles.headline: Iowa Saturated by Political Ads
articles.snippet: Campaigns are spending more on ads in Iowa, hoping to sway undecided voters.
articles.abstract: Campaigns are spending more on ads in Iowa, hoping to sway undecided voters.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES  One week before Iowa kicks off the presidential nomination contest, the campaigns are spending three times as much money flooding the airwaves and the Internet as candidates did in 2004, hoping to sway the huge number of undecided voters after months of on-the-ground appeals.

articles.headline: Weak Data Puts Shares in a Tailspin
articles.snippet: Weak economic data and concerns about fallout from the assassination of the Pakistani opposition leader, Benazir Bhutto, pushed shares lower on Thursday.
articles.abstract: Weak economic data and concerns about fallout from the assassination of the Pakistani opposition leader, Benazir Bhutto, pushed shares lower on Thursday.
articles.lead_paragraph: American stock markets tumbled and oil prices surged on Thursday as investors grappled with weak economic data and concerns about financial fallout from the assassination of the Pakistani opposition leader, Benazir Bhutto.

articles.headline: China Finds American Allies for Security
articles.snippet: For the Olympics, some American companies are helping to design one of the most high-tech surveillance systems.
articles.abstract: For the Olympics, some American companies are helping to design one of the most high-tech surveillance systems.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING  In preparation for the Beijing Olympics and a series of other international events, some American companies are helping the Chinese government design and install one of the most comprehensive high-tech public surveillance systems in the world.

articles.headline: Salvaging U.S. Diplomacy Amid Division
articles.snippet: The assassination left in ruins the diplomatic effort the Bush administration had pursued in the last year.
articles.abstract: The assassination left in ruins the diplomatic effort the Bush administration had pursued in the last year.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The assassination of Benazir Bhutto on Thursday left in ruins the delicate diplomatic effort the Bush administration had pursued in the past year to reconcile Pakistan’s deeply divided political factions. Now it is scrambling to sort through ever more limited options, as American influence on Pakistan’s internal affairs continues to decline.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: Credit Crisis? Just Wait for a Replay
articles.snippet: How different was subprime lending from other lending in the days of easy money that prevailed until this summer?
articles.abstract: How different was subprime lending from other lending in the days of easy money that prevailed until this summer?
articles.lead_paragraph: What if it’s not just subprime?

articles.headline: A Post-Google Fraternity of Investors
articles.snippet: A growing number of Google millionaires are hoping to parlay their newfound wealth into even greater riches by bankrolling technology start-ups.
articles.abstract: A growing number of Google millionaires are hoping to parlay their newfound wealth into even greater riches by bankrolling technology start-ups.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Chris Sacca had a plum job as the Wi-Fi guru at Google. But with his stock options fully vested, he left the Internet search company this month for a new career as a venture capitalist.

articles.headline: Under Attack, Drug Maker Turned to Giuliani for Help
articles.snippet: The work that Rudolph W. Giuliani’s consulting firm did for the maker of OxyContin provides a window into how he used his standing to aid a client.
articles.abstract: The work that Rudolph W. Giuliani’s consulting firm did for the maker of OxyContin provides a window into how he used his standing to aid a client.
articles.lead_paragraph: In western Virginia, far from the limelight, United States Attorney John L. Brownlee found himself on the telephone last year with a political and legal superstar, Rudolph W. Giuliani.
articles.byline: By Barry Meier and Eric Lipton

articles.headline: Bhutto Assassination Ignites Disarray
articles.snippet: As Ms. Bhutto’s body arrived in her family village, protests and riots broke out across the country.
articles.abstract: As Ms. Bhutto’s body arrived in her family village, protests and riots broke out across the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan  Benazir Bhutto, the Pakistani opposition leader and twice-serving prime minister, was assassinated Thursday evening as she left a political rally here, a scene of fiery carnage that plunged Pakistan deeper into political turmoil and ignited widespread violence by her enraged supporters.
articles.byline: By Salman Masood and Carlotta Gall
